page.title: 18Local History
page.content: The golf course on Petitor used to be a racecourse,there were many races held there.Race meetings were held there from 1864 to Easter 1940.The grandstand was demolished in 1945.In 1893 the{DEVON AGRICULTURAL SHOW}was held at the racecourse.The racecourse was also used for a flower show.In 1910 {THE TORQUAY & DEVON GOLF CLUB was opened.The council have decided to put a new road through the golf course as soon as the money is available!!If so {St. MARYCHURCH {PRIMARY SCHOOL} might get a playing field. In Maidencombe {THE COURT HOUSE {HOTEL}was converted from the local court house.Visiting Judges used to stay and try criminals.You can still see the former cell and bars.The foundation of this building is mentioned in the {DOMESDAY BOOK.
